revised_title: Investigations in the Infra-Red Region of the Spectrum: The Absorption Spectra of Chlorine Dioxide and Sulfur Dioxide
tldr: The authors investigated the infra-red absorption spectra of chlorine dioxide and sulfur dioxide, finding that their spectra are very similar. They used this information to determine the molecular structure and constants of these molecules, supporting the triangular form of both substances. The study also discusses the normal modes of vibration and the vertical angles of the molecules.
